description: Activates an DataSync agent that you deploy in your storage environment. The activation process associates the agent with your Amazon Web Services account. If you haven't deployed an agent yet, see Do I need a DataSync agent?

parameters.name: ActivationKey
parameters.description: Specifies your DataSync agent's activation key. If you don't have an activation key, see Activating your agent.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least one tag for your agent. (dict) --- A key-value pair representing a single tag that's been applied to an Amazon Web Services resource. The key for an Amazon Web Services resource tag. Value (string) --- The value for an Amazon Web Services resource tag.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key for an Amazon Web Services resource tag.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value for an Amazon Web Services resource tag.

parameters.name: VpcEndpointId
parameters.description: Specifies the ID of the VPC service endpoint that you're using. For example, a VPC endpoint ID looks like vpce-01234d5aff67890e1.

parameters.name: SubnetArns
parameters.description: Specifies the ARN of the subnet where your VPC service endpoint is located. You can only specify one ARN. (string) ---

parameters.name: SecurityGroupArns
parameters.description: Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the security group that allows traffic between your agent and VPC service endpoint. You can only specify one ARN. (string) ---

nested_items.name: AgentArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the agent that you just activated. Use the ListAgents operation to return a list of agents in your Amazon Web Services account and Amazon Web Services Region.
